basics.name: Colbren Fujimoto
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the College of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

work.summary: Develop real-time embedded software for NASA-contracted satellite missions
highlights: Developed real-time embedded software in C++ for NASA-contracted satellite missions, including control interfaces for EPS and ADCS
Created a testbed using AlphaBot2-Pi robots to simulate autonomous satellite swarm coordination, enabling early-stage validation of swarm formation control algorithms
Implemented an AHRS with Madgwick filtering and sensor fused UWB and IMU data, enabling real-time orientation tracking within 10° and position accuracy within 10 cm on AlphaBot2-Pi robots

work.summary: Medical diagnostics and vision-language model safety under Dr. Liuwan Zhu, focusing on large language model evaluation for lung cancer detection and geolocation privacy defenses
highlights: Utilized Dino, SAM2, and PixelSHAP to quantify the importance of individual geolocation cues in images interpreted by OpenAI’s o3 model, leading to the creation of an automated counterfactual defense framework that obscures sensitive visual features

Fine-tuned model parameters using tree-based feature importance and trained on specialized datasets to evaluate large language model performance for lung cancer detection using a random forest classifier

work.summary: Worked on autonomous navigation, computer vision, and ground station of rover simulating mars missions
highlights: Fused RTK GNSS and IMU data via EKF to enhance GPS coordinate accuracy from ~3 m to ~10 cm
Developed a ROS–Qt monitoring interface for real-time rover health/status, lifecycle node management, and sensor/trajectory visualization
Designed a SLAM-based path planner to optimize shortest-path navigation while avoiding obstacles, increasing exploration coverage efficiency by ~40%
Utilized YOLOv8 for object detection and ARUCO marker tracking for robust real-time computer vision in dynamic environments for reliable object localization

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Lead in providing mentorship for 3rd to 5th-grade students developing fundamental design principles and problem-solving skills through the engineering design process
Created the curriculum for a LEGO Mindstorms EV3 robotics camp; designed engaging engineering-related activities and challenges

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Earned a UH Manoa semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher

awards.title: Academic Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.5 at a Hawai'i public school.
